3. YouHodler – A Regulated Crypto Wallet With APY rewards And Security Features

YouHodler is a Swiss and EU-regulated crypto wallet designed to meet various needs, from earning high APY to getting crypto loans. 

With features like MultiHODL, Cloud Miner, and an integrated exchange, it offers a comprehensive solution for traders and investors.

The platform provides APYs of up to 15% on popular crypto like Litecoin and Solana. Stablecoins like USDT and USDC offer a solid 12% APY, depending on your account level. 

You still get a competitive 6% APY on stablecoins, even at the Basic level. Bitcoin holders also have a chance to earn up to 4.5% APY and additional BTC through Cloud Miner.

MultiHODL gives you access to trading tools and low, transparent fees if you’re more into active asset management. 

The exchange feature lets you swap over 60 trading pairs through desktop and mobile applications. API support for automated trading rounds out a robust trading experience.

YouHodler’s crypto loan feature is a plus for those needing immediate funds without selling assets. With a high loan-to-value ratio of 90%, you can collateralize your assets for fiat currencies like USD, EUR, CHF, GBP, or stablecoins. The loan offer starts at a minimum of $100.

Your assets are secured using Ledger Vault technology, covered by $150 million in pooled crime insurance. 

Additionally, 2FA and biometric options are available for account security. YouHodler is regulated in Switzerland and some EU countries, giving an extra layer of assurance.

YouHodler also offers a loyalty program and has plans to introduce a debit card. Its high TrustPilot rating and active social media presence on platforms like Twitter and Telegram highlight its credibility.

Pros

  • Compatibility with a variety of cryptos
  • Earn up to 15% APY on select digital assets
  • Opportunity to accumulate Bitcoin via Cloud Miner
  • 90% LTV for asset-backed loans
  • Integrated crypto to fiat conversion

Cons 

  • Unavailable for users in the United States
  • Loan offers start at a $100 minimum
Visit YouHodler

 

4. Ledger – Hardware Wallet for High Security and Flexibility Supporting 5500+ Cryptos

Ledger stands out as a promising option for those prioritizing the highest level of security in crypto storage. 

Started in 2014, it offers a range of hardware wallets designed to keep digital assets in cold storage, thus safeguarding them from online threats.

One of Ledger’s key strengths is its cold storage approach, which keeps your assets offline during transactions. 

To initiate an outgoing transaction, you must confirm it on the Ledger device by entering a user-created PIN. A unique feature is the 24-word passphrase, which is your private key. Ledger also allows adding a 25th word, up to 100 characters, increasing security measures. 

Even if someone gains access to your 24-word passphrase, they still can’t access your wallet without the 25th word. Moreover, the wallet can be remotely recovered if stolen.

Ledger Live, the proprietary mobile and desktop app, improves user experience by providing an interface to monitor your crypto portfolio. 

This application isn’t just a monitoring tool; it allows users to connect to third-party services like 1inch DEX, MoonPay, and Lido staking, among others, for better utility.

The Ledger wallet can connect to mobile and desktop devices via USB cable or Bluetooth. This is particularly significant in the case of the Ledger Nano X model, which offers Bluetooth connectivity, enabling transactions on smartphones without the need for cables.

Ledger offers three primary products: Ledger Stax, Ledger Nano X, and Ledger Nano S Plus. Each product caters to different security needs and budget constraints. The Ledger Nano S Plus is the most affordable at $79.

Moreover, it has wide-ranging support for over 5,500 cryptos, covering networks like Bitcoin, Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain, Cardano, Monero, XRP, and Stellar.

Ledger also offers an extensive library of educational content, including tutorials and guides on staking coins, cloud mining, and more, making it a comprehensive platform for beginners and experienced crypto enthusiasts.

Pros

  • Compatibility with a vast range of over 5,500 cryptos
  • Flexibility to add custom tokens on multiple chains
  • Staking options are available, even in cold storage

Cons 

  • Subject to fees as high as 5%
  • Not an open-source wallet
     
Visit Ledger

 

5. Trezor – Cold Wallet Device Aimed at Long-Term Crypto Investors   

Trezor is one of the best crypto wallets in South Africa for long-term investors. This is a cold wallet device that does not expose private keys to the internet. And hence, investors can rest assured that their cryptocurrencies cannot be hacked remotely. What’s more, even if the Trezor device is lost, damaged, or stolen – the funds can be recovered via the backup passphrase. 

This is provided when the wallet is set up for the first time and should be written down and kept somewhere safe. Another safeguard is that cryptocurrencies can only leave the Trezor wallet when the PIN is entered on the device. Not only that but unlike its main competitor Ledger, the Trezor wallet is open source. 

This ensures that any potential vulnerabilities are made available to the crypto community. We also like that Trezor supports more than 1,200 cryptocurrencies across multiple blockchain standards. This includes everything from Bitcoin and Ethereum to Cardano to BNB. Trezor also allows investors to add custom tokens, as long as the underlying network is supported. 

In terms of pricing, there are two Trezor models to choose from. The Trezor Model One costs $69 (about 1,300 ZAR), while the Model T retails for $219 (about 4,100 ZAR). The latter comes with additional features, such as an in-built staking tool and a more convenient touchscreen LCD pad. That said, the $69 model offers the same level of robust security as the premium version.       

Pros

  • Best Bitcoin wallet in South Africa for long-term investors
  • Robust security features – including cold storage 
  • Supports more than 1,200 cryptocurrencies 
  • Recover lost, damaged, or stolen devices via the backup passphrase 

Cons 

  • Will not appeal to active crypto traders 
  • The basic model does not support staking
  • ZAR payments are handled by third parties 
Visit Trezor

 

6. Trust Wallet – Popular Non-Custodial Crypto Wallet Used by Over 60 Million People 

Trust Wallet is popular with South Africans that prefer non-custodial storage. This means that only the wallet owner has access to the private keys. And hence, users can store, send, and receive cryptocurrencies without going through an intermediary. Trust Wallet – which is used by over 60 million people, is completely free to use. 

It is available on multiple device types and operating systems. This includes a mobile app for Android and iOS, as well as a browser extension for Chrome and other web browsers. The setup process is very simple, and Trust Wallet provides users with a 12-word passphrase. This is to be used if the wallet PIN is forgotten or the device is lost or stolen. 

Trust Wallet supports more than 70 blockchains, making it ideal for diversified portfolios. This includes all tokens on the Bitcoin, Ethereum, Cardano, XRP, Binance Smart Chain, Arbitrum, and Polygon networks. Trust Wallet also stores NFTs across multiple network standards. We also found that Trust Wallet is ideal for earning passive income on idle crypto tokens. 

It comes with an in-built staking tool that supports many proof-of-stake cryptocurrencies. This includes Tron, Tezos, Osmosis, Kava, and BNB. No staking fees are charged by Trust Wallet. Moreover, users can swap tokens via Trust Wallet without paying any fees. Trust Wallet also connects to Web3 applications like PancakeSwap and Uniswap. 

Pros

  • Best Bitcoin wallet for South Africans seeking decentralized storage
  • Supports over 70 blockchain standards
  • Completely free to use and available as a browser extension or mobile app
  • Stake and swap cryptocurrencies without paying fees
  • Used by more than 60 million people globally 

Cons 

  • Pay up to 5% to buy cryptocurrencies with ZAR
  • No browser extension for Firefox or Edge
Visit Trust Wallet

 

7. Binance – User-Friendly Web Wallet Aimed at Active Crypto Traders     

Binance offers one of the best crypto wallets for South African traders. It is a leading crypto exchange that doubles up as a user-friendly web wallet. The Binance wallet is custodial, so users are not provided with their private keys. The wallet comes with a variety of security controls, including IP and device whitelisting. It also comes with two-factor authentication. 

Behind the scenes, Binance operates both hot and cold wallets. This provides an adequate balance between security and accessibility. Binance users can trade and store over 350 cryptocurrencies. This includes the most popular cryptocurrencies, such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, BNB, Cardano, Tether, USD Coin, and Solana. 

There is no requirement to transfer funds from the wallet to access the Binance exchange. Thousands of trading markets are supported, with South African traders paying a commission of just 0.1%. South Africans can also access leveraged markets, including futures and options. This is in addition to Binance savings accounts and other DeFi features. 

This offers a seamless way to earn income on idle cryptocurrencies. For example, Ethereum holders can currently earn an APY of 4.27%. This is a flexible account without any withdrawal limits or fees. A 90-day savings account for Axie Infinity offers a huge APY of 32%. While Polkadot holders can earn 14.9% on a 120-day lock-up term.  

Pros

  • Best Bitcoin app for active crypto traders
  • Deep liquidity and low trading commissions of 0.1%
  • Uses a combination of hot and cold wallets
  • Two-factor authentication and IP/device whitelisting 

Cons 

  • As a custodial wallet, users do not have access to their private keys
  • The Binance exchange was hacked in 2022  
Visit Binance

 

8. MetaMask – Top Decentralized Wallet for Storing ERC20 Tokens   

MetaMask is an established crypto wallet used by over 30 million people globally. This is a decentralized wallet that will appeal to investors wanting to take custodianship over their cryptocurrencies. MetaMask does not ask for personal information, and it does not have access to the user’s password or private keys.

This allows South Africans to store their wealth away from centralized bodies. Although MetaMask does not support Bitcoin, it’s one of the best crypto wallets for storing ERC20 tokens. Any ERC20 token can be added to MetaMask via its unique contract address. MetaMask also supports layer 2 blockchains, including Polygon, Arbitrum, and Avalanche. 

This is in addition to all tokens operating on the Binance Smart Chain. There are no fees to download or use MetaMask. The wallet supports multiple devices, including smartphones and web browsers. Supported operating systems include iOS and Android, plus extensions for Chrome, Firefox, Edge, and Brave. 

MetaMask does not charge any additional fees when sending cryptocurrencies to another wallet. Users simply pay the real-time blockchain fee. MetaMask supports an in-built staking tool for Ethereum, backed by Rocket Pool and Lido. It also supports token swaps, but users will be charged a markup of 0.875%. ZAR payments are processed by third parties, costing 3-5%.  

Pros

  • Popular non-custodial wallet used by over 30 million people
  • Supports Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain, and a selection of layer 2 blockchains
  • Free to store cryptocurrencies with no markups on outgoing transfers
  • Completely decentralized – only the user has access to their password and private keys  

Cons 

  • 0.875% markup charged when swapping tokens
  • Does not support Bitcoin
Visit MetaMask

 

9. OKX – Non-Custodial Wallet App Supporting Over 50 Blockchain Standards      

OKX is a popular crypto exchange that also offers a non-custodial wallet. The wallet is decentralized and does not connect to the primary OKX wallet. There is no requirement to open an account, and only the wallet user has access to their private keys. The OKX wallet supports more than 50 blockchain standards. 

This includes Bitcoin, Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain, and Arbitrum. It also allows users to add custom tokens via the project’s contract address. In terms of security, users can activate MPC (Multi-Party Computation) security via the OKX app. This means that there is no single point of failure, a major safeguard when keeping private keys secure.  

Instead, the private keys are split into smaller segments and secured in multiple, unknown locations. This ensures that the OKX wallet remains safe against remote hacking attempts. The wallet is also secured with a backup passphrase. This will be needed if the user forgets their wallet PIN or the device is lost or stolen. 

One of the best features of the OKX wallet is its bridge aggregator. This allows users to instantly swap tokens without leaving the wallet. It also allows users to earn income on idle tokens via staking and yield farming. These tools are integrated with over 200 decentralized exchanges, allowing OKX users to get the most competitive rates. 

Pros

  • Decentralized wallet backed by MPC security 
  • Supports more than 50 blockchain standards
  • Aggregates to over 200 exchanges for staking, token swaps, and other DeFi features
  • Compatible with smartphones, desktop devices, and Chrome browsers 

Cons 

  • Does not display token swap commissions until the order is created
  • Some yield farming pools have little liquidity  
Visit OKX

 

10. Coinbase – Global Crypto Exchange With a Secure Custodial Wallet      

Coinbase – one of the largest crypto exchanges for trading volume, also offers a secure custodial wallet. This wallet provider is popular with beginners that want a simple but regulated place to buy and store cryptocurrencies. Coinbase holds many licenses in the US and several international markets. It also offers premium security features. 

For example, Coinbase accounts are protected by cold storage, two-factor authentication, and device whitelisting. Coinbase also has an internal security team, and all accounts must go through a KYC process. We also like that Coinbase supports over 100 cryptocurrencies. This includes Bitcoin, Ethereum, Dogecoin, USD Coin, Tether, and Litecoin. 

The Coinbase wallet supports web browsers and smartphones. The latter comes as an app for iOS and Android. Coinbase is also popular with South Africans that want to trade crypto against ZAR. This removes the need to pay foreign exchange fees. That said, trading commissions are high at 1.49%. There is also a 3.99% fee to buy crypto with a debit/credit card. 

Pros

  • Custodial wallet is robust security features – including two-factor authentication
  • Buy, sell, and store cryptocurrencies in one regulated place
  • Comes as a mobile app or web wallet 
  • Stake idle cryptocurrencies at APYs of up to 109.6%  

Cons 

  • Charges 1.49% in standard trading commissions
  • Withdrawals are often slow  
Visit Coinbase

 

11. Exodus – Free Crypto Wallet Supporting 50+ Networks and Multiple Device Types   

Exodus is an established crypto wallet that supports over 50 blockchain networks. This includes everything from Bitcoin and Binance Smart Chain to Ethereum, Cardano, and Litecoin. Exodus is also a multi-device wallet, compatible with desktops, mobiles, and web browsers. This includes software for Windows, Mac, Android, iOS, Chrome, and Brave. 

Exodus offers non-custodial storage, so does not have access to the user’s private keys or password. There is no requirement to provide any personal information when downloading Exodus, allowing South African investors to remain anonymous. We also like that Exodus is free to use, and no markups are charged when sending cryptocurrencies to another wallet. 

Exodus also connects to Web3 applications and comes with an in-built staking tool. The latter supports multiple staking coins, including VeChain, Tezos, Cardano, and Cosmos. Currently, APYs of up to 18.9% are available. We also like that Exodus comes with portfolio management tools. This includes a full breakdown of key investment statistics, such as real-time values.    

Pros

  • Online Bitcoin wallet supporting 50+ other blockchain networks
  • Available as desktop software, a mobile app, and a browser extension 
  • No fees to store or receive cryptocurrencies    
  • Comes with an in-built staking tool with APYs of up to 18.9%

Cons 

  • High fees to buy crypto with ZAR – up to 5.45% 
  • Limited security tools 
Visit Exodus

 

Tips for Selecting the Best South Africa Bitcoin Wallet 

Investors should do lots of independent research when researching the best Bitcoin wallets in South Africa. This means assessing security, usability, supported coins, fees, and other important factors. 

Still undecided on the best South Africa Bitcoin wallets? Read on for assistance on how to select the most suitable wallet in 2024. 

Type of Wallet

South African investors should consider the type of crypto wallet that is most preferable for their needs. 

This begins with a choice between custodial or non-custodial storage. 

  • Custodial wallets: Investors have no access to their private keys. The custodian is responsible for keeping the crypto wallet safe.
  • Non-custodial wallets: Private keys are provided when setting up the wallet. The investor is responsible for keeping the crypto wallet safe.  

What’s more, South Africans need to choose the device type to store their crypto wallet. 

Mobile apps offer a great level of security and convenience. Another option is desktop or browser-based wallets. When opting for a software wallet, make sure the respective operating system is supported. 

Those holding a large amount of cryptocurrencies might be more suited for a hardware or paper wallet. 

Supported Coins

Next, South Africans need to ensure their chosen cryptocurrencies are supported by the wallet. For example, while MetaMask is one of the best crypto wallets in South Africa – it doesn’t support Bitcoin, Cardano, or Solana. 

It’s best to choose a wallet that supports a wide range of cryptocurrencies and network standards. In doing so, investors can store their cryptocurrencies in the same place. 

Fees

Most software wallets are free to use. This means there are no fees to store or receive cryptocurrencies. While GAS fees apply on outgoing transactions, the best crypto wallets in South Africa do not charge any markups. 

Hardware wallets are not free. They must be purchased from the manufacturer, and prices will vary considerably. Investors should ensure that the cost price is justified, based on the value of their crypto portfolio. 

For example, those investing very small amounts likely won’t want to buy the Trezor Model T – which retails for approximately 4,100 ZAR. 

Extra Functionality

The best crypto wallets in South Africa offer extra functionality, such as being able to trade tokens. This removes the need to use a third party when buying and selling cryptocurrencies. 

For example, the Best Wallet allows users to buy and sell cryptocurrencies with a credit card, and they support multi-chain tokens. 

The Binance wallet is also great for additional features. It supports staking, savings accounts, yield farming, and leveraged trading. The latter includes futures and options. 

We also like the OKX wallet, which bridges to over 200 exchanges. OKX users subsequently get the best interest rates when earning yields on idle tokens. 

Security Controls

The best crypto wallets in South Africa offer a breakdown of what security controls are provided. 

This might include:

  • IP/Device Whitelisting: Additional security steps are needed when logging into the wallet from a new IP address or device. 
  • Two-Factor Authentication: The user will need to enter a unique code when logging in. This is either sent to the user via email or SMS. 
  • Cold Storage: Keeping cryptocurrencies in cold storage means the private keys remain away from live internet servers. This makes them practically impossible to hack remotely. 
  • Multi-Sig Permissions: Some crypto wallets offer multi-sig permissions. The user will need to verify outgoing transactions on multiple devices. 
  • MPC: MPC technology is offered by the OKX wallet. It splits the private key into multiple segments and stores each part in a unique location.
  • Regulation: The best crypto wallets in South Africa are regulated.

How do Crypto Wallets Work? 

Looking for some guidance on how crypto wallets actually work?

Here’s what South African investors need to know before getting started. 

Wallet Addresses

Once a suitable wallet has been chosen, the investor will need to set it up. This will generate a new, unique wallet address. The wallet address allows the investor to receive cryptocurrencies from another location. 

Think of it like an electronic funds transfer (EFT), which requires the sender to specify the receiver’s personal account number. The wallet address is safe to share with other people, as it simply allows the user to receive tokens via the blockchain. 

Each blockchain network has its own wallet address standard. For example, Ethereum wallets always start with 0x. Nevertheless, if the wrong wallet address is provided, the tokens will be sent to an incorrect location. This means the tokens will be unrecoverable. 

Private Keys

If the investor opts for a non-custodial wallet, they will be provided with unique private keys when getting started. This is usually provided as a 12-word passphrase, but some wallets use a much longer combination. 

Either way, private keys must never be shared with another person. Nor should they be kept on a device that connects to the internet. 

If they end up in the wrong hands, the private keys will allow an unauthorized person to access the wallet. This is one of the most common reasons for crypto wallets being hacked remotely. 

Custodial wallets do not provide users with their private keys. This is because the custodian is responsible for keeping the cryptocurrencies safe. Custodial wallets are popular with beginners, but investors should ensure the provider is regulated. 

Wallet Fees

Software wallets are usually free to use. There are no fees to store or receive cryptocurrencies. But fees are charged when sending cryptocurrencies to another wallet. 

The best crypto wallets in South Africa do not charge a markup on network fees. Instead, fees go directly to blockchain miners. 

Fees are quoted in real-time and rise and fall based on network demand. 

Crypto hardware wallets, however, are not free. Prices vary depending on the provider and model type. For example, Trezor charges $69 and $219 for its basic and advanced models. 

What are the Different Types of Bitcoin Wallets?

Once South African investors have chosen between a custodial or non-custodial wallet, the preferred device type should be considered. Wallets come as mobile apps, desktop software, browser extensions, and hardware devices. Investors should also consider whether they prefer a hot or cold wallet. 

We will now discuss the main types of crypto wallets that are available to South Africans in 2024. 

Software Wallets

Some of the most popular crypto wallets in South Africa come as software. This includes desktop software for Windows, Max, and Linux. The software is installed on the desktop device and allows users to store, send, and receive cryptocurrencies via a laptop or PC. 

Another option for desktop users is wallets that come as a browser extension. Some providers offer support for Chrome, Firefox, and other popular web browsers. 

An even more convenient option is mobile wallet apps. This allows users to store cryptocurrencies on their smartphones. As such, this makes sending, receiving, and trading cryptocurrencies a breeze. 

Hardware Wallets

A more secure option is to buy a Bitcoin hardware wallet. As noted above, prices will vary, with Trezor charging $69 for its basic device.

Hardware wallets come with the added benefit of cold storage. In simple terms, this means the cryptocurrencies and private keys are never exposed to live internet servers. 

Safeguards are also in place to protect investors from physical theft. This is because cryptocurrencies can only leave the hardware wallet if the PIN is entered on the device itself.  

Paper Wallets

We also found that paper wallets are increasingly becoming popular with South African investors. After generating a public address and private key, the user will print the credentials. 

This keeps the wallet offline at all times. It is imperative that the paper wallet is kept somewhere safe. It is also important to ensure the paper wallet provider is legitimate and that private keys are encrypted when initially shown to the user. 

Both paper and hardware wallets offer excellent security, but do make it cumbersome to send and trade cryptocurrencies.  

Tutorial on How to Get and Use a Bitcoin Wallet in South Africa

We mentioned earlier that Best Wallet is the overall best crypto wallet in South Africa. In this section, we explain how to get started with this wallet in under five minutes. 

Step 1: Download the Best Wallet app

South African investors will first need to download the Best Wallet app on the App Store or Google Play. 

Step 2: Open the Best Wallet App

First, you need to verify your email address. Next, you’ll be asked to secure your account with a two-factor authentication. If you want to, you can skip this step and activate this feature later.

Whether you activate 2FA or not, you’ll be asked to set up a four-digit password. You can also enable biometrics to unlock your wallet if your smartphone supports this feature.

Step 3: Create a Wallet

Now that we have secured the app, go ahead and create your first wallet. This will be your main wallet on the Ethereum blockchain. At this stage you can create multiple wallets and name them, for example, “Meme coin wallet” or “Storage” or whatever you want.

Choose a background color for each wallet. This will help you identify each wallet fast. 

Tap “Continue” when ready.

Step 4: Use Best Wallet

Your next step is to use the wallet to buy coins with a card or to send and receive tokens. You can swap the tokens you have as well. The more you use the wallet during this stage, the greater the odds of getting the $BEST token airdrop in Phase 6.

How Safe are Crypto Wallets?

While varying levels of security are offered, crypto wallets are never 100% secure from hackers and scams. Moreover, investors need to take steps to protect their wallet credentials. 

  • For example, custodial wallets remove the need for investors to secure their private keys. 
  • But this isn’t to say that the wallet is immune to fraud. 
  • On the contrary, investors should make use of two-factor authentication and any other safeguards offered by the custodian. 
  • Coinbase, for instance, allows users to set up IP and device whitelisting. 
  • This means an extra security step kicks in if the user attempts to access the wallet from a new IP address or device. 

Security procedures will differ when opting for a non-custodial wallet. This is because there is no custodian to protect the investor’s cryptocurrencies. Instead, only the user has access to their private keys, meaning they must take full responsibility for keeping them safe. 

Non-custodial wallets do not come with two-factor authentication or whitelisting. This is because there is no custodian sitting between the investor and their cryptocurrencies. 

That said, we like that the OKX wallet comes with MPC technology. This means that only a small segment of the private key is stored on the user’s device. The remaining segments are stored across multiple locations. 

Some non-custodial wallets come with multi-sig permissions. This is a security tool that requires outgoing transfers to be confirmed on at least two devices. Just like MPC technology, this removes a single point of failure – making it challenging for remote hacks to succeed. 

The Verdict

Wallets ensure that South Africans can invest in the crypto market safely. While there are many crypto wallets in the market, we particularly like Best Wallet. 

The Best Wallet can hold coins from various blockchains, it can seamlessly swap them, and you can store your NFTs in a single mobile app. Upcoming features include market insights and token analysis, which will make Best Wallet the ultimate Web3 crypto hub for your tokens. 

Visit Best Wallet

What crypto wallets are available in South Africa?

Dozens of crypto wallets are available to South African investors, with leading providers including Best Wallet, Trust Wallet, Trezor, and MetaMask. 

Can South Africa use Coinbase wallet?

Yes, South Africans have access to the non-custodial Coinbase wallet, as well as its centralized exchange. 

Does Binance wallet work in South Africa?

Yes, the Binance wallet not only supports South African investors but ZAR deposits and withdrawals.

What is the best South Africa crypto wallet?

One of the best South Africa crypto wallets is Best Wallet, which allows investors to store and trade cryptocurrencies from multiple blockchains.

The post 9 Best Crypto Wallets in UAE – The Complete 2024 List appeared first on Cryptonews.

]]>

The UAE is one of the most crypto-friendly nations globally, with residents benefiting from favorable tax laws and fair regulation. But which crypto wallet should UAE investors use?

In this guide, we review the best crypto wallets in the UAE for 2024. We cover a wallet for all investor profiles, from active traders and long-term investors to those holding large crypto balances. 

List of the Best Crypto Wallets for UAE Investors

The best UAE crypto wallets for 2024 are ranked below:

  1. Best Wallet – Best Wallet offers the best crypto wallet for UAE investors and traders alike. That’s because it can store coins and tokens from multiple blockchains like Ethereum, Polygon and BNB, with Bitcoin planned to be added in the future. What’s more, you can easily swap these tokens between chains or store your NFTs through a single mobile app. With its upcoming features like market insights, advanced charts and token analytics and sentiment, Best Wallet may well become the ultimate personal Web3 hub.
  2. YouHodler – Offers a Swiss-regulated, multi-feature crypto wallet with up to 15% APY earnings on popular cryptos and 12% on stablecoins. With a 90% loan-to-value ratio, it allows asset collateralization for instant loans. The platform also supports 60+ trading pairs and automated trading via API, all secured by $150 million in insurance and 2FA options.
  3. Ledger – A high-security hardware wallet supporting 5,500+ cryptos and featuring cold storage capabilities. Available in two models, Nano S Plus and Nano X, it offers Bluetooth connectivity and is compatible with Ledger Live for portfolio management and DeFi interaction.
  4. Trezor – UAE investors with large exposure to Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies will like Trezor. This hardware wallet offers superb security, not least because the device remains in cold storage. Users will need to set up a PIN, which needs to be entered when making transfers. Trezor connects to the blockchain via Bluetooth or a USB cable. It supports 
  5. MetaMask – Non-custodial storage will appeal to some investors in the UAE; so MetaMask should also be considered. This decentralized wallet provider is used by more than 30 million people, and it supports Ethereum and all ERC20 tokens. Additional networks can be added, but this doesn’t include Bitcoin. MetaMask is best used as a browser extension, but it also offers a mobile app for iOS and Android. 
  6. Binance – Binance, which is approved by the  Abu Dhabi Global Markets Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA), is the best crypto wallet for UAE traders. More than 350 cryptocurrencies are supported, and trading commissions are industry-leading at 0.1% per slide. The Binance wallet supports staking, yield farming, and savings accounts too. 
  7. Trust Wallet – Another non-custodial wallet that is popular in the UAE is Trust Wallet. The wallet comes with various tools, including staking and token swaps. It supports dozens of blockchain networks, including Bitcoin, Binance Smart Chain, and Ethereum. Trust Wallet is available as an app and browser extension. 
  8. Exodus – Exodus appeals to both beginners and experienced traders. It is a decentralized wallet supported by desktops and iOS/Android mobiles. It also offers a browser extension. Exodus supports over 50 blockchains, and it allows users to add custom tokens. Exodus is free to use, and it comes with staking tools.  
  9. OKX – One of the best crypto wallets in the UAE for passive investors is OKX. This decentralized wallet supports thousands of coins, savings accounts, and yield farming pools. It sources the highest yields, so UAE investors don’t need to search across different exchanges. The OKX wallet also supports token swaps at competitive fees. 

Top Crypto Wallets in the UAE: Full Reviews  

We have compiled comprehensive reviews of the best Bitcoin wallets in the UAE. 

Some of the most important factors we consider include wallet security, usability, supported coins, features, fees, and transparency. 

UAE investors can read on to choose the best online Bitcoin wallet for their needs. 

1. Best Wallet – The Overall Best Crypto Wallet for UAE Traders and Investors

Best Wallet is the overall best crypto wallet for UAE investors. From a single mobile app on iOS and Android, you get to hold coins and tokens from various blockchains like Ethereum, Polygon and BNB, with Bitcoin blockchain support planned for the future.

You can easily swap these coins between chains, which removes the need to have multiple crypto wallets for each blockchain. On top of that, the team plans to add NFT support that will allow you to store your digital collectibles and exchange them directly from the Best Wallet app.

All this is made possible via the built-in Best DEX. This is a decentralized exchange that lets anyone swap their coins and tokens without signing up for an account. All you have to do is connect your crypto wallet and start swapping.

Active users of the Best Wallet and the Best DEX are eligible for the $BEST token airdrop planned for the future.

The $BEST token is designed to be both a utility and a governance token. The utility part comes in the form of feeless swaps and access to new token launches and NFT drops. On the other hand, the governance part will allow you to vote in the Best Wallet’s future decisions.

At the moment, Best Wallet has the basic functionalities ready where you can buy crypto with a card and swap it. In the future, new updates will add market insights with advanced price charts, as well as crypto news and token analysis where users can track investor sentiment or discover trending tokens.

As for security, Best Wallet uses two-factor authentication and PIN or biometrics, depending on your smartphone. This means that even if a bad actor gets a hold of your device, they won’t be able to unlock your wallet.

Overall, the Best Wallet aims to become the ultimate personal Web3 hub where you can hold multi-chain coins, swap them, hold your NFTs and analyze the crypto market all within one mobile app.

Make sure to follow Best Wallet on X and the Best Wallet Telegram channel to get new information on upcoming releases and $BEST token airdrops.

Pros

  • Overall best crypto wallet for UAE investors 
  • Supports multiple blockchains like Ethereum, Polygon and BNB
  • Employs 2FA and biometrics for unlocking
  • Buy and sell cryptocurrencies without leaving the wallet
  • NFT gallery and marketplace
  • Using the app makes you eligible for $BEST token airdrops 

Cons 

  • No crypto wallet browser extension available at the moment
  • Third-party fees for buying crypto with a credit card
Visit Best Wallet

 

2. YouHodler – Highly Secure Crypto Wallet with Passive Income Potential Of 15% APY

YouHodler is a promising crypto wallet founded in 2019, offering multiple of features, including yield earnings, crypto loans, and an integrated exchange. 

Regulated in Switzerland and the EU, it ensures strong security measures like Ledger Vault technology with $150M in pooled crime insurance and 2FA authentication.

You can earn up to 15% APY on cryptos like Litecoin and Solana. For stablecoins like USDT and USDC, you can get up to 12% APY. 

However, the basic yield for stablecoins starts at 6%. Moreover, tiered rewards are available based on trading volume and loyalty levels, allowing you to maximize earnings.

YouHodler also provides a unique Cloud Miner feature. Here, you can earn up to 0.2 BTC per month by completing tasks to get ‘sparks,’ which can be used to mine Bitcoin blocks.

The platform lets you get fiat loans using your crypto assets as collateral. They offer a high loan-to-value ratio of 90%, and you can take loans in various fiat currencies like EUR, USD, CHF, and GBP. 

Over 50 cryptos, including Bitcoin, Ethereum, and more niche coins like AXS and MANA, are accepted as collateral.

YouHodler’s built-in exchange supports over 60 trading pairs and is accessible in 100+ countries. The MultiHODL feature is a full trading suite offering low and transparent fees. It allows you to earn 12% APR on deals, which can be initiated with either fiat or stablecoins.

The wallet is ideal for traders and investors and is accessible through desktop and mobile applications. It also has a loyalty program and an upcoming debit card feature to launch soon.

Interested users can join the YouHolder Telegram channel for the latest updates.

Pros

  • Multi-crypto support for broad investment options
  • High yields up to 15% on specific cryptos
  • Cloud Miner feature for Bitcoin earning
  • Loans backed by a high 90% LTV ratio
  • In-built crypto-to-fiat exchange 

Cons 

  • U.S. residents excluded from the platform
  • Minimum loan requirement of $100
Visit YouHodler

 

3. Ledger – Promising High-Security Hardware Wallet Supporting 5500+ Cryptos

Established in 2014, the Ledger hardware wallet offers one of the safest ways to store digital assets through cold storage. 

Designed for those who prioritize top-tier security, Ledger caters to a diverse audience, including investors in the UAE.

Ledger offers two primary models: the Ledger Nano S Plus and the Ledger Nano X. Both models serve the same purpose of cold storage but differ in additional features like Bluetooth compatibility, available in the Nano X.

These hardware wallets can be connected to your desktop or mobile device using a USB cable or Bluetooth, and they’re compatible with Ledger Live, Ledger’s dedicated app.

It requires a PIN to confirm outgoing transactions, a feature only available on the device. This ensures that even if someone gains access to your computer or mobile, they cannot transact without the PIN.

Ledger also provides a 24-word passphrase, essentially your private key, and allows for an additional custom 25th word. 

This extra layer of security ensures that even if someone knows your passphrase, they can’t access your assets without the 25th word. If your device is lost or stolen, it can be remotely recovered.

With Ledger Live, you can monitor your crypto portfolio, buy assets, and interact with decentralized apps. It also supports NFTs.

Ledger supports over 5,500 cryptos across diverse networks such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain, and Cardano.

Ledger provides options to suit different budgets and security needs. The Ledger Nano S Plus retails for $79, depending on your location.

Pros

  • A wide range of supported cryptos exceeding 5,500
  • Capability to include custom tokens across different networks
  • Cold storage staking allows for secure yield generation

Cons 

  • Fiat transactions processed by Simplex, incurring up to 5% fees
  • Lacks open-source transparency
Visit Ledger

 

4. Trezor – Emerging for UAE Investors With Large Exposure to Crypto   

Trezor is the Bitcoin hardware wallet for security. There is a wide range of safeguards that ensure the stored cryptocurrencies do not get into the wrong hands. First and foremost, Trezor is a cold wallet, so it’s never connected to the internet. 

Rest assured, this removes the risk of the wallet being hacked remotely. Second, cryptocurrencies cannot leave the Trezor device unless the user’s PIN is entered. Third, Trezor transactions are authorized without needing to connect to a server. Instead, USB type A or C cables are used, depending on the Trezor model purchased. 

The Trezor Model T costs $219 (about 800 AED) and comes with a digital touchscreen for confirming transactions. The Trezor Model One costs $69 (about 250 AED) and uses a more clunky two-pad button. That said, the Model One is just as secure as the advanced version. Moreover, both the Model One and T support over 1,000 coins, including Bitcoin and Ethereum.    

Pros

  • Suited to AED investors with large exposure to cryptocurrencies 
  • Supports more than 1,000 coins
  • Superb security features – including PIN-only transfers and cold storage
  • Can be recovered remotely if the device is stolen 

Cons 

  • Only the Model T supports staking 
  • Inconvenient to transact – so won’t appeal to short-term traders 
Visit Trezor

 

5. MetaMask – Popular Wallet for UAE Investors That Prefer Non-Custodial Storage  

Another option to consider is MetaMask, which is the best crypto wallet in the UAE for non-custodial storage. This means that users do not need to trust a third party when storing their cryptocurrency investments. MetaMask provides users with their private keys via a 12-word passphrase. The wallet provider cannot see the keys, as the information is encrypted. 

But do remember that if the password and backup passphrase are misplaced, MetaMask cannot help recover the wallet. Moreover, MetaMask comes with limited security features. Nonetheless, we like that MetaMask is available as a browser extension or mobile app for Android and iOS. It is free to download and use, and no fees are charged when storing and receiving cryptocurrencies.

 

We also like that MetaMask doesn’t charge any additional fees for outgoing transfers. Instead, GAS fees are forwarded directed to the blockchain in real-time. In terms of supported cryptocurrencies, MetaMask comes pre-installed with an Ethereum wallet address. This accepts all ERC20 tokens, including Tether, USD Coin, and DAI. 

Although Bitcoin is not supported, several other networks can be added to the MetaMask wallet manually. This includes Binance Smart Chain, Avalanche, and Optimism. MetaMask also supports the best Arbitrum network tokens. Although MetaMask is free to use, it comes with several paid-for features. This includes token swaps, Ethereum 2.0 staking, and AED deposits.    

Pros

  • KYC-free non-custodial storage – investors hold and control their private keys
  • One of the best crypto wallets in the UAE for Ethereum investors 
  • Stake Ethereum 2.0 at an APY of 3.96%
  • Manually add a selection of other networks – including Abritrum and Binance Smart Chain

Cons 

  • Buying crypto with AED costs up to 5%
  • Does not support Bitcoin
Visit MetaMask

 

6. Binance – Hybrid Wallet and Exchange With Licensing From the FSRA     

Binance is a crypto wallet and exchange that is popular with short-term UAE traders. It holds a license with the FSRA in Abu Dhabi and directly accepts AED payments. The Binance wallet can be accessed by logging in with a username and password. Two-factor authentication and other security features are offered. 

For example, Binance reports that its Safe Asset Fund for Users (SAFU) is now valued at over $1 billion. This is used as an insurance fund in the event Binance is hacked. Moreover, the Binance wallet also comes with IP whitelisting. Should a user login from an unrecognized IP address, an additional two-factor authentication process is undertaken.    

But the main attraction of the Binance wallet is having access to its exchange. The Binance exchange is the largest by trading volume, and it supports hundreds of cryptocurrencies. UAE investors will pay just 0.1% when trading. Moreover, the Binance wallet also supports staking, yield farming, and savings accounts. APYs are very competitive, too. 

For example, some staking pools are currently yielding almost 20%. While Binance savings accounts are offering APYs of over 30%. We also like that Binance offers advanced trading tools and complex crypto derivatives. The latter includes Bitcoin futures, options, and perpetual contracts. Binance also offers great customer support via live chat, 24/7. 

Pros

  • Best crypto wallet in the UAE for trading 
  • Approved by the FSRA in Abu Dhabi
  • Wallets are protected by two-factor authentication and other security tools
  • Competitive yields offered on savings accounts and staking pools

Cons 

  • AED deposit fees are unclear – built into the exchange rate 
  • Binance was hacked in 2022  
Visit Binance

 

7. Trust Wallet – Self-Custody Wallet Supporting Over 70 Blockchains  

Trust Wallet offers self-custody cryptocurrency storage on multiple device types. This includes a browser extension for Chrome and an Android and iOS app. The wallet is completely decentralized, and only the user has control of the private keys. Similar to MetaMask, Trust Wallet encrypts the private keys as a 12-word passphrase. 

Trust Wallet comes with many in-built features, most of which are fee-free. For example, users can swap tokens across different blockchains without leaving the wallet. Trust Wallet also supports staking. We found that staking APYs are very competitive. For instance, Trust Wallet users can earn 10% on Kava and over 19% on Cosmos. 

Trust Wallet also has a fiat money facility that supports AED payments. However, this is provided by Simplex, so fees of up to 5% will be charged. Trust Wallet is also the go-to option for accessing Web3 applications, like Uniswap, Yearn.finance, or ApeSwap. The Trust Wallet balance can be used when accessing these decentralized platforms, making it simple to swap and earn. 

Where Trust Wallet really stands out is its support for over 70 blockchain networks. This includes everything from Bitcoin, Binance Smart Chain, Polygon, and Ethereum to Arbitrum, Solana, Cardano, and XRP. Therefore, Trust Wallet is the best crypto wallet in the UAE for diversified portfolios. 

Pros

  • Great option for diversified portfolios – supports over 70 blockchain standards
  • No fees to swap or stake tokens from within the wallet interface
  • Can be downloaded as an iOS/Android app or installed as a Chrome extension 
  • Competitive APYs of over 19% when staking 

Cons 

  • Buying crypto with AED will cost up to 5%
  • No support if the wallet is hacked or the private keys are misplaced 
Visit Trust Wallet

 

8. Exodus – One of the Best Desktop Crypto Wallets for Portfolio Management    

Many UAE investors prefer to manage their cryptocurrencies on a desktop device – and Exodus is one of the best Bitcoin wallets in this regard. The Exodus software is compatible with all major operating systems, including Windows, Mac, and Linux. Once installed, users will need to create a password and write down their 12-word passphrase. 

Exodus supports the most popular cryptocurrencies. It is compatible with over 50 blockchain networks, including Bitcoin, Binance Smart Chain, and Ethereum. If a particular cryptocurrency isn’t supported, users can add it to Exodus manually. Exodus comes with a very user-friendly interface that is great for managing portfolios. 

It can display cryptocurrency balances in AED based on real-time market prices. Exodus also makes it easy to make informed investment decisions. This is because it offers tons of portfolio management tools and a full breakdown of key statistics. In addition to its desktop software, Exodus is also available as a browser extension and a mobile app. 

The latter makes it seamless to keep tabs on crypto balances, as well as send and receive tokens. Users can connect the desktop and mobile app together by importing their 12-word passphrase. Additional features include staking and token swaps. Staking rewards of over 19% are currently available. Exodus also supports AED payments, but fees of up to 5.45% will apply.    

Pros

  • Best crypto wallet in the UAE for desktop users
  • User-friendly dashboard with handy portfolio management tools
  • Custom tokens can be added to over 50 blockchain networks 
  • Also offers a browser extension and mobile app

Cons 

  • High fees to buy crypto with AED – up to 5.45% 
  • Security features are limited – users are responsible for keeping their private keys safe 
Visit Exodus

 

9. OKX – Top-Rated Wallet for Swapping and Earning Cryptocurrencies        

OKX offers a decentralized, Web3 wallet that is compatible with multiple devices. Users can choose from a mobile app, desktop software, or browser extension. The wallet provides users with their private keys when getting started. That said, users can also switch the ‘MPC’ feature on. This will distribute mini-segments of the private key across multiple locations. 

OKX claims that this makes the wallet resistant to remote attacks. Another feature of the OKX wallet is its support for over 60 networks. This includes Bitcoin, Ethereum, Cronos, Arbitrum, Optimism, Binance Smart Chain, and Solana. Any token can be added by entering the project’s contract address. 

Moreover, OKX is the best crypto wallet for UAE traders looking to earn yields on their investments. It bridges to 200+ DeFi platforms that support staking, yield farming pools, and savings accounts. This secures the best APYs for OKX wallet users. The OKX wallet also allows users to trade cryptocurrencies. However, fiat payments are not supported.     

Pros

  • Non-custodial wallet with MPC security 
  • Available as an app, desktop software, and browser extension
  • Thousands of cryptocurrencies supported across 60+ networks
  • One of the best crypto wallets in the UAE for earning high staking APYs 

Cons 

  • Swap commissions are not displayed until the order is created
  • More suited to experienced crypto investors  
Visit OKX

 

Crypto Wallets Explained 

When investing in crypto in the UAE, the first step is to choose a suitable exchange to complete the purchase. The next step is to choose a wallet to store the purchased crypto assets. This is where things can get confusing, considering the sheer number of crypto wallets in the market.

To help clear the mist, a good starting point is to understand how crypto wallets actually work. 

In basic terms, crypto wallets store digital currencies. Wallets usually come as software. For instance, desktop software for Windows and Mac or a mobile app for iOS and Android. That said, some wallets come as hardware devices, such as Trezor. 

All wallets come with a unique address for each supported cryptocurrency. For example, Bitcoin will have its own wallet address, and this is required when receiving tokens. When sending tokens to another wallet, the receiver’s address will be needed. If using a mobile wallet, the sender can scan the receiver’s address via a QR code. If not, the wallet address can be pasted in. 

Unlike traditional bank wires, crypto transactions are sent on a wallet-to-wallet basis. This means they do not go through a third party. Instead, wallet-to-wallet transactions are processed by the blockchain network. 

While storing, sending, and receiving tokens are the main functions of a crypto wallet, other features are often available.

How do Crypto Wallets Work? 

Now let’s take a much more detailed look at how crypto wallets work. 

Let’s start with custodianship:

Wallet Custodianship

In order to choose the best crypto wallet in the UAE, investors must understand how custodianship works. This is important, as it determines who is responsible for looking after the cryptocurrencies. 

A simple analogy is to think about how traditional money is stored. 

  • When using a custodial storage option, the money would be deposited into a bank. The bank is then responsible for keeping the money secure. To access the money, permission needs to be granted by the bank. 
  • Those who do not trust banks would need to consider a non-custodial option, such as keeping the money at home in a safe. This gives full control of the money, as no permission is needed to access it. But equally, this increases the risks of theft. 

The same concept is true for crypto wallets. 

For example, custodial wallets like Binance are responsible for keeping client cryptocurrencies safe. They do not provide users with their private keys as a safety precaution. As licensed custodians, these wallet providers have institutional-grade security practices in place. 

Alternatively, non-custodial wallets like Best Wallet give users their private keys when getting started. The wallet provider cannot access the private keys. Only the user can. 

Choosing between a custodial or non-custodial wallet is ultimately down to the investor’s experience. While beginners will likely prefer a regulated custodian, experienced investors might feel more comfortable safeguarding their own wallets. 

Wallet Addresses

In order to send and receive cryptocurrencies via the blockchain, wallet addresses are needed. Each blockchain will have its own wallet address format. 

For example, this is what a Bitcoin wallet address looks like:

1F34duy2eeMz5mSrvFepVzy7Y1rBsnAyWC

And here’s an example of an Ethereum wallet address:

0x868daB0b8E21EC0a48b726A1ccf25826c78C6d7F

Both are equally long and complex. But crucially, no two wallet addresses can be the same. This is similar to a bank account number. 

So, sending funds to another person requires the destination wallet address. And vice versa when receiving cryptocurrencies into the wallet. 

Providing a wallet address to another person is not a security threat. Just like giving someone a bank account number, wallet addresses only allow people to send funds. 

But do note that wallet addresses are public. This means anyone can view the wallet balance if they have the address. Data analytic websites like Blockchain.com and BitInfoCharts provide this information.  

Wallet Private Keys

Crypto wallets also come with a unique set of private keys. Similar to wallet addresses, they are complex in nature. Private keys provide access to wallets and the cryptocurrencies stored within them. This means that private keys should be protected at all costs. 

For example, instance, private keys should never be stored on a device that can connect to the internet. If they are, they are at risk of being hacked remotely. The hacker would then be able to access the wallet and drain the cryptocurrencies stored. 

  • The best practice for securing private keys is to write them on a sheet of paper. 
  • For added security, the private keys could be split and written down on multiple sheets. 
  • This way, if someone comes across the sheet of paper, they would only have part of the private key – which wouldn’t provide them access to the wallet. 

But ultimately, safeguarding private keys can be intimidating for beginners. This is why custodial wallets are often the better option.  

Do You Need a Crypto Wallet? What to Consider  

According to a Crypto.com study, there are 219 million Bitcoin holders globally. However, the number of people that use Bitcoin for transactions is very small. For example, BitInfoCharts data shows that in the prior 24 hours, there were just over 880,000 active Bitcoin addresses. 

This means that the vast majority of people that own Bitcoin do not transact. Instead, Bitcoin is purchased as an investment. In practice, this means that UAE residents do not actually need a crypto wallet to invest in this space. 

On the other hand, UAE investors wanting to send and receive cryptocurrencies will need a wallet. This will provide them with a unique wallet address and the ability to transfer funds without going through a third party.  

What are the Different Types of Bitcoin Wallets?

We have covered custodianship, public addresses, and private keys in great detail. The next step for UAE investors is to learn about the different types of crypto wallets. 

Let’s start with the most common type – software wallets.  

Software Wallets

Software wallets allow investors to send and receive funds remotely. There are generally four options to choose from in this regard:

  • Web Wallet: Web wallets are offered by custodians like Binance. No software is actually required, as investors can access their web wallets by logging into their accounts.  
  • Mobile Wallet: Mobile wallets like Best Wallet come as an app. They allow users to send, receive, and store cryptocurrencies no matter where they are located. This option is suitable for active traders that want full control of their cryptocurrencies. 
  • Desktop Wallet: Another option is to download a desktop wallet. Usually supported for Windows and Mac, this offers a more user-friendly experience when transacting. But desktop wallets are less convenient, and transactions can only be verified when the user has access to their device. 
  • Browser-Based Wallet: Some of the best crypto wallets in the UAE come as a browser extension. The wallet is installed in a browser like Chrome or Firefox. This makes it simple to trade cryptocurrencies online – especially on decentralized exchanges.  

Hardware Wallets

Hardware wallets do not allow investors to transact with the blockchain remotely. 

Instead, they come as a hardware device, and the private keys are never exposed to the internet. To transact, a PIN needs to be entered on the hardware wallet. 

We found that one of the best crypto hardware wallets for UAE investors is the Trezor Model One. This retails for just $69 or about 250 AED.    

Paper Wallets

The less common option is a paper wallet. This is a cost-effective version of a hardware wallet, as the private keys are never connected to live servers. This is because the private keys are printed and kept somewhere secure and private – like in a safe. 

Paper wallets will not appeal to UAE investors who want to regularly send, receive, or trade cryptocurrencies. 

Tips for Selecting the Best UAE Bitcoin Wallet

There are many variables to consider when researching the best UAE Bitcoin wallets. Not only in terms of the wallet type and custodianship, but security, supporting coins, and core features. 

Here’s what to consider when choosing a UAE crypto wallet:

  • Custodianship: First, do some research on the pros and cons of both custodial and non-custodial wallets. As noted earlier, a great analogy is to consider how money is stored. Those that prefer to keep money in a bank can opt for a regulated custodial wallet. Those who prefer keeping money at home in a safe can opt for a non-custodial wallet. 
  • Device Type: The most popular wallets are available on multiple devices. For example, wallets come as mobile apps, browser extensions, and desktop software. Hardware wallets are another option. 
  • Supported Coins: The best crypto wallets in the UAE support many different coins and network standards. Best Wallet supports coins from various blockchains, including Ethereum, Polygon and BNB, with Bitcoin blockchain planned for a future update. 
  • Fees: Hardware wallets must be purchased, so consider the costs before proceeding. Software wallets are free to download. Storing and receiving cryptocurrencies should also be free. Some wallets charge markups when sending cryptocurrencies. These wallets should be avoided.  
  • Security: Security features will vary depending on the wallet type. Non-custodial hot wallets like Trust Wallet and MetaMask come with limited security features. Cold wallets like Trezor are super-secure.  
  • User-Friendliness: UAE investors should also choose a crypto wallet that is suitable for their experience. The best user-friendly wallet is offered by Binance. On the other hand, OKX comes with many features, but it’s more suitable for experienced investors.  
  • Features: We like crypto wallets that come with extra features. For example, being able to buy crypto with AED or swap tokens without leaving the wallet. Staking and yield farming tools are handy for earning passive income. 

Tutorial on How to Get and Use a Bitcoin Wallet in UAE

This section provides a step-by-step walkthrough on how to set up the Best Wallet. 

We found that Best Wallet offers the best crypto wallet app for UAE investors. Not only is it non-custodial, meaning you have full control over your funds, but the app allows users to send and receive funds via multiple blockchains. 

Step 1: Download the Best Wallet app

UAE investors must download the Best Wallet app from the App Store or Google Play, depending on the device.

Step 2: Open the Best Wallet App

When you open the app, you’ll be asked to verify your email address. The next step is to activate a two-factor authentication to improve the app’s security. However, you can skip this step and activate 2FA later on if you want to.

Whether or not you activate 2FA, you’ll have to set up a four-digit password next. There’s an option to enable biometrics such as fingerprint or face ID if your device supports any of those features.

Step 3: Create a Wallet

Your first wallet is on the Ethereum blockchain. You can now create multiple wallets, give them names, such as “Trading wallet” or “NFT storage” and select a background color. This is designed so that you can quickly identify each wallet. 

Tap “Continue” when ready.

Step 4: Use Best Wallet

Now you can buy crypto with a card, receive coins from exchanges or other wallets and swap them. Active Best Wallet users may get $BEST tokens airdropped in Phase 6 of the development of this wallet.

How Safe Are Crypto Wallets?

Each wallet type will come with its own level of security. Not only in terms of the device type, but whether it’s a custodial or non-custodial wallet. UAE investors should also consider whether the wallet offers hot or cold storage. 

Let’s break down the most important factors;

  • Cold Wallets: Cold wallets offer the highest level of security. They are never connected to a live internet server, so this removes a major risk – remote hacking attempts. Hot wallets are usually non-custodial, such as Trezor. 
  • Hot Wallets: In contrast, hot wallets offer a much lower level of security, because they are always connected to a live internet server. Hot wallets come as both custodial and non-custodial options. For example, the Binance web wallet is custodial. While the Exodus wallet is non-custodial, as users are provided with their private keys. 

When deciding between a custodial or non-custodial wallet, assessing the security features is paramount. 

For example, non-custodial wallets like Trust Wallet and MetaMask come with limited safety features. These wallets are only protected by a password. If the device that the wallet is stored on is compromised, the private keys would be hacked. 

Custodial wallets offer many safety features – from two-factor authentication, regulation, and analytic behavior machine learning. On the flip side, investors are trusting a third party to look after their cryptocurrencies. This is much the same as trusting a bank to store money. 

The Verdict

There are many considerations to make when choosing the best crypto wallet for UAE investors. But overall, we found that the Best Wallet offers the ideal balance between safety, convenience, and features. 

The Best Wallet can hold coins from multiple blockchains, it can swap them, and you can safely store your NFTs. With upcoming updates, you’ll get market insights and token analytics. Active Best Wallet users can get $BEST tokens airdropped in the future.  

Visit Best Wallet

FAQs

Which is the best crypto wallet in UAE?

Best Wallet – a regulated custodian and exchange, offers the best crypto wallet for UAE traders seeking a safe place to store and trade cryptocurrencies. 

Can you use Coinbase in the UAE?

No, Coinbase is only available to trades in the US, Canada, Europe, and the UK. 

Are Bitcoin wallets legal in the UAE?

Yes, the UAE is a crypto-friendly nation with solid regulation – so Bitcoin wallets are perfectly legal. 

Can UAE residents use Binance?

Yes, not only can UAE residents use Binance, but the exchange has been approved by the Abu Dhabi Global Market’s Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA).

1. Mega Dice – Best Overall Tether Casino Site, 200% Bonus + 50 FS

Launched in 2012 as ‘SatoshiDice,’ this casino now goes by the name Mega Dice and is the first-ever licensed crypto casino provider to use Telegram for games. Despite the platform being accessible in the United Kingdom and Australia, you can access Mega Dice through Telegram without KYC enforcement. They can sign-up easily, where they will be redirected to a web application to deposit crypto.

Deposits can be made on Mega Dice with Tether (USDT). The minimum deposit is set at just 1 USDT. However, users can also use other popular cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Dogecoin, Litecoin, Tron, Ripple, Cardano, and Bitcoin Cash. To avail the welcome bonuses – 200% matched deposit bonus up to 1 BTC – you’ll have to make a minimum deposit of $20. You’ll also get 50 free spins on the Wanted Dead or a Wild slot machine.

You can play over 5,000 slot games, 27 game shows, and over 500 table games – all provided by some of the best gaming developers, including Hacksaw, Betsoft, and Pragmatic Play. The platform also offers a sportsbook, making 40+ sports betting markets available to the public. The popular options include Soccer, Basketball, Table Tennis, Rugby, MMA, and Football.

Users can access some of the top live casino games, including Poker, Baccarat, Bac Bo, and Roulette. The platform also supports fiat payment options such as VISA.

Platform members can also earn free BCD – as one token is allocated for every $400 wagered on the platform. How We Select the Best Tether Casinos


The sections below discuss some of the factors to consider when determining the best Tether Casinos.

Secure Crypto Payments

Security is one of the most factors to look at when determining the top Tether casinos. All the top Tether Casinos in the list provide secure cryptocurrency payment options and allow investors to safely access Tether and other digital assets on their platforms.

Fast Deposits & Withdrawals

Fast deposits and withdrawals are one of the most crucial factors new Tether casino users look at before choosing their preferred USDT gambling sites. Some of the best Tether Casino sites such as BC.Game and Cloudbet support quick withdrawals and instant deposits.

USDT will be withdrawn in five minutes from Lucky Block.

Crypto Bonuses & Promos

The sections above have mentioned the individual sign-up bonuses for each of the 13 Tether gambling sites. For instance, BC.Game offers between 180% – 240% matched deposit bonuses spread across the first four deposits.

Other sites like Punt Casino offer 500 free spins through their promotional schemes, while Lucky Block has 15% cashback on losses for the first seven days.

Low Crypto Banking Fees

Many of the top Casino sites on our list do not charge additional fees. Most of the fees depend on the costs generated from the particular cryptocurrency’s network.

Lucky Block does not charge any fees on deposits or withdrawals.

Fair Deposit & Withdrawal Limits

Since a high deposit or withdrawal can be a deal breaker for many cost-conscious investors, we have listed the price limits for the top Casino sites in the above sections. Popular sites like Cloudbet have a minimum 50 USDT deposit limit, while BC.Game has a $10 minimum deposit.

Lucky Block, meanwhile, has a minimum deposit of just $1 with no fees and no fees or limits on withdrawals.

Wide Range of Crypto Betting Markets

The above-mentioned sites offer gambling options on multiple markets, including sports betting, esports, live casinos, poker and cryptocurrency games. USDT casinos like Winz.io give users access to more than 7,500 games – including live dealer games such as Casino Hold ‘em and Craps.

Good Betting Features & Resources

When gambling with Tether and other cryptocurrencies, users look for other betting features from the top sites. For instance, many of the best Casino sites host competitions and regular weekly rounds to entice new customers.

Most sites have monthly prize pools, as well as seasonal ones around big events, with many sites also having VIP programs to offer additional rewards to their loyal users.

USDT Casino Bonuses


The sections below discuss some of the bonuses customers can receive from the top Tether Casino sites.

Deposit Match Bonuses

Many of the best USDT-based Casino sites offer bonuses to new customers. Depending on the deposit amount, investors can earn a bonus that matches the level of their initial deposit. For example, BC.Game offers a matched deposit bonus anywhere from 180% to 240% for the first four deposits.

Free Spins


Many Tether Casino sites also offer free spins as a part of the sign-up bonus. Cloudbet offers 100 free spins – allowing users to stand a chance to win additional rewards from various esports games, live poker tables and more.

Conclusion


In the fast-paced world of online gambling, Tether casinos with USDT bonuses have emerged as a compelling option for many players. While traditional casinos reign supreme for some, Tether’s unique features and the generous bonuses offered by these platforms unlock a range of benefits worth considering.

After analyzing the top Tether casino sites – we recommend Mega Dice as the best option to choose from.

Players can access thousands of games and a sportsbook and begin with just a 1 USDT minimum deposit, while there are no fees or limits on deposits and withdrawals. Sign-up is quick and easy –  USDT withdrawals take only five minutes.

Visit Mega Dice

FAQs

Can you gamble with Tether?

All of the top Tether Casino sites allow users to use Tether (USDT) to bet on games such as Poker, Blackjack, eSports, real sports, and more.

Which online casinos accept Tether?

Lucky Block, Mega Dice, BC.Game, Cloudbet, Bitslot, mBit and Hell Spin are among some popular Casinos that accept Tether as a payment option.

What is the best Tether casino site?

Mega Dice is our recommended best Tether casino. With a 1 USDT minimum deposit, players can bet on slots, Blackjack, Roulette, table games and access sports betting. Players can also benefit from cashback rewards, reload bonuses and massive giveaways with Mega Dice

Is gambling with Tether legal?

Largely, yes, but it depends entirely on your jurisdiction. The legal landscape surrounding gambling and cryptocurrency, especially Tether, is complex and varies greatly by country or region.
